p: Most components of EOs act as GABA receptor agonists. Only a few compounds from EOs have been demonstrated to be GABA A receptor antagonists. Thujone ( Figure 6), a cyclic monoterpenic ketone, is an active ingredient of wormwood oil and some other herbal medicines [ 91, 116]. It is known that thujone is specifically a GABA A receptor antagonist and, by inhibiting GABA receptor activation, may make neurons fire more easily, causing muscle spasms and convulsions [ 116, 117]. Dihydrocarvone ( Figure 6) is present in oils of the caraway plant and is used for its fragrance as flavoring and for medicinal purposes. Dihydrocarvone was recently found to act as a negative allosteric modulator of this receptor [ 91].
